definition: lit. devil's gate, crooked path (idiom); corrupt practices/crooked methods/dishonesty
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
askew/at a crooked angle/devious/noxious/(coll.) to lie on one's side

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: I wonder whether the so-called master under the Eighth Ground is a true Buddhist practitioner or a preacher of evil sects?
sentences.chinese: 八地以下的师傅是正信的三宝还是邪门歪道？

sentences.english: Exsanguination , as long as my blood wasn't being used for something awful.
sentences.chinese: 因放血而死，只要我的血没被用在邪门歪道上。

sentences.english: He said he was afraid Larry'd gone bad and wouldn't come back any more.
sentences.chinese: 他说他担心拉里已经走上邪门歪道，不会再回来了。

definition: dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to harm sb/to inflict suffering/to victimize/pernicious
variant of 下三濫|下三滥[xia4 san1 lan4]
lit. dress up as God, play the devil (idiom); fig. to mystify/to deceive people/to scam
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
